001package intermediate;
002
003import com.sandwich.koan.Koan;
004
005import java.io.*;
006import java.util.logging.Logger;
007
008import static com.sandwich.koan.constant.KoanConstants.__;
009import static com.sandwich.util.Assert.assertEquals;
010
011public class AboutFileIO {
012
013    @Koan
014    public void fileObjectDoesntCreateFile() {
015        File f = new File("i-never.exist");
016        assertEquals(f.exists(), __);
017    }
018
019    @Koan
020    public void fileCreationAndDeletion() throws IOException {
021        File f = new File("foo.txt");
022        f.createNewFile();
023        assertEquals(f.exists(), __);
024        f.delete();
025        assertEquals(f.exists(), __);
026    }
027
028    @Koan
029    public void basicFileWritingAndReading() throws IOException {
030        File file = new File("file.txt");
031        FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(file);
032        String data = "First line\nSecond line";
033        fw.write(data);
034        fw.flush();
035        fw.close();
036
037        char[] in = new char[data.length()];
038        int size = 0;
039        FileReader fr = new FileReader(file);
040        size = fr.read(in);
041        // No flush necessary!
042        fr.close();
043        assertEquals(size, __);
044        String expected = new String(in);
045        assertEquals(expected.length(), __);
046        assertEquals(expected, __);
047        file.delete();
048    }
049
050    @Koan
051    public void betterFileWritingAndReading() throws IOException {
052        File file = new File("file.txt");
053        file.deleteOnExit();
054        FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(file);
055        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(fw);
056        pw.println("First line");
057        pw.println("Second line");
058        pw.close();
059
060        FileReader fr = new FileReader(file);
061        BufferedReader br = null;
062        try {
063            br = new BufferedReader(fr);
064            assertEquals(br.readLine(), __); // first line
065            assertEquals(br.readLine(), __); // second line
066            assertEquals(br.readLine(), __); // what now?
067        } finally {
068            // anytime you open access to a file, you should close it or you may
069            // lock it from other processes (ie frustrate people)
070            closeStream(br);
071        }
072    }
073
074    private void closeStream(BufferedReader br) {
075        if (br != null) {
076            try {
077                br.close();
078            } catch (IOException x) {
079                Logger.getAnonymousLogger().severe("Unable to close reader.");
080            }
081        }
082    }
083
084    @Koan
085    public void directChainingForReadingAndWriting() throws IOException {
086        File file = new File("file.txt");
087        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(file);
088        pw.println("1. line");
089        pw.println("2. line");
090        pw.close();
091
092        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
093        // Add the loop to go through the file line by line and add the line
094        // to the StringBuffer
095        assertEquals(sb.toString(), "1. line\n2. line");
096    }
097}
098
